name: Chickpea Pot
author: Recipe Revival
summary: Warm up during the cold months with this hearty chick-pea and ham dish. This recipe was found in an old recipe box and was typed word-for-word.
ingredients: 1 pound Italian sausage links, cut into chunks
directions: Put chickpeas and water in a large pot; soak beans 8 hours to overnight
Or, bring the beans and water to a boil in a large pot over high heat
Once boiling, turn off the heat, cover, and let stand 1 hour
Add ham hocks, oregano, and bay lead to the water and chickpeas; bring to a boil, place a lid on the pot, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer until the chickpeas are tender, about 2 hours
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat
Saute sausage chunks in hot skillet until some of the fat renders, 2 to 3 minutes; add onion, bell pepper, and garlic and saute until lightly browned, about 5 minutes
Add sausage mixture to the mixture in the pot along with Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper
Bring the mixture to a simmer, cover the pot, and cook until the sausage chunks are no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes
